title: [Large-scale] Social Learning for Sustainability Thinking: Reflective Practice-Based Mathematics Projects

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (functions, statistics, etc.) and proficiency in fundamental digital tools
context.additional_context: An asynchronous learning environment in a BYOD setting, utilizing online collaboration tools (e.g., Google Workspace). Emphasis is placed on mathematical modeling and data visualization for project-based outcomes.

learning_goals: Learners can design mathematical models for sustainability problem-solving and perform data-driven decision-making.
Learners can analyze their thinking processes and derive improvement strategies through reflective journaling during learning.
Learners can share social learning experiences and develop collective problem-solving strategies through peer feedback.

resources: Online Collaboration Platforms (Google Jamboard, Padlet, etc.)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
